message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE. 

The paper focuses on applying a recurrent neural network (RNN) encoder framework to community question answering (cQA) tasks, which involves natural language processing and information retrieval. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses techniques such as transfer learning and multitask learning, which are common in machine learning and artificial intelligence research, suggesting that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are also likely sub-categories. The use of an information retrieval-based approach and the comparison to a handcrafted feature-based method suggest that cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the use of neural attention mechanisms and the focus on improving performance suggest that cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is a less likely but still possible sub-category.
